no.motif

Class Strings

  • java.lang.Object
    • no.motif.Strings

  • public final class Strings
extends Object
    Functions operating on strings.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Predicate<String> alphabetic
      Alphabetic strings are at least one character, and all letters.
      static Predicate<String> alphanumeric
      Alphanumeric strings are at least one character, and all digits and/or letters.
      static Predicate<String> blank
      A blank string is either null, empty, or all characters are whitespace.
      static Fn2<String,Object,String> concat
      Concatenate a string with the string representation of an arbitrary object, i.e.
      static Fn<String,Integer> length
      Gives the length of a string, i.e. the amount of characters.
      static Fn<String,String> lowerCased
      Convert a string to lower case.
      static Predicate<String> nonblank
      A nonblank string has at least one character, and must contain at least one character which is not whitespace.
      static Predicate<String> numeric
      A numeric string must have at least one character, and all of them must be digits.
      static Fn<String,Iterable<Character>> toChars
      Splits a string into characters.
      static Fn<String,Double> toDouble
      Converts a string to a double value using Double.valueOf(String).
      static Fn<String,Integer> toInt
      Converts a string to a int value using Integer.valueOf(String).
      static Fn<String,String> trimmed
      Trims a string, removing all leading and trailing whitespace.
      static Fn<String,String> upperCased
      Convert a string to upper case

    • Field Detail

      • toInt

        public static final Fn<String,Integer> toInt
        Converts a string to a int value using Integer.valueOf(String). If the string is null, 0 is yielded.

      • toDouble

        public static final Fn<String,Double> toDouble
        Converts a string to a double value using Double.valueOf(String). If the string is null, 0 is yielded.

      • toChars

        public static final Fn<String,Iterable<Character>> toChars
        Splits a string into characters.

      • blank

        public static final Predicate<String> blank
        A blank string is either null, empty, or all characters are whitespace.

      • nonblank

        public static final Predicate<String> nonblank
        A nonblank string has at least one character, and must contain at least one character which is not whitespace.

      • numeric

        public static final Predicate<String> numeric
        A numeric string must have at least one character, and all of them must be digits.

      • alphanumeric

        public static final Predicate<String> alphanumeric
        Alphanumeric strings are at least one character, and all digits and/or letters.

      • alphabetic

        public static final Predicate<String> alphabetic
        Alphabetic strings are at least one character, and all letters.

      • trimmed

        public static final Fn<String,String> trimmed
        Trims a string, removing all leading and trailing whitespace.

      • lowerCased

        public static final Fn<String,String> lowerCased
        Convert a string to lower case.

      • upperCased

        public static final Fn<String,String> upperCased
        Convert a string to upper case

      • length

        public static final Fn<String,Integer> length
        Gives the length of a string, i.e. the amount of characters. null yields length 0.

      • concat

        public static final Fn2<String,Object,String> concat
        Concatenate a string with the string representation of an arbitrary object, i.e. reduces two strings to one.

    • Method Detail

      • allChars

        public static final Predicate<String> allChars(Predicate<Character> valid)
        Predicate verifying that all characters in a string satifies a given predicate.
        Parameters:
        valid - The predicate evaluating all characters in a string.

      • nonblankAllChars

        public static final Predicate<String> nonblankAllChars(Predicate<Character> valid)
        Predicate verifying that strings are not blank and each char satisfies a given predicate.
        Parameters:
        valid -

      • hasLength

        public static final Predicate<String> hasLength(int exactLength)
        Evaluate if strings are of a exact length. nulls are considered to have length zero.

      • hasLength

        public static final Predicate<String> hasLength(Predicate<? super Integer> accepted)
        Evaluate if strings have accepted lengths. nulls are considered to have length zero.
        Parameters:
        accepted - The predicate evaluating accepted length.
        Returns:
        The predicate evaluating string length.

      • contains

        public static Predicate<String> contains(CharSequence charSequence)
        Determines if a substring is present in a string. A string never contains null, nor does null contain any substring.
        Parameters:
        charSequence - The substring to find.
        Returns:
        The predicate.

      • startsWith

        public static Predicate<String> startsWith(String prefix)
        Determines if a string starts with a given prefix string.
        Parameters:
        prefix - The prefix.
        Returns:
        The predicate.

      • endsWith

        public static Predicate<String> endsWith(String suffix)
        Determines if a string ends with a given suffix string.
        Parameters:
        suffix - The suffix.
        Returns:
        The predicate.

      • matches

        public static Predicate<String> matches(String regex)
        Does a regular expression match on strings.
        Parameters:
        regex - The regular expression to use for matching.
        Returns:
        the predicate.
